news_header: King Thutmose II's tomb discovered in Luxor, first royal tomb found in over a century, revealing significant artifacts.
news_original_title: Egypt says unveils first king's tomb in over a century
news_text: The tomb of King Thutmose II, an 18th Dynasty Egyptian king, has been unveiled in Luxor, marking the first royal tomb discovery in over a century. Despite being poorly preserved due to flooding, significant artifacts were found, offering insights into ancient Egyptian history.
